Affects: (1) Workforce cost modeling - if attrition 25-40% annually need 3-4X hiring budget vs 10-15% baseline assumption, (2) Operational continuity risk - high attrition in FedRAMP/VMware/platform roles creates authorization/service jeopardy, (3) Retention program ROI - cannot design targeted interventions without knowing who leaves when and why, (4) Acquisition integration planning - if buyer inherits high-attrition workforce, must factor replacement costs and knowledge loss. uncertainty_register.what_would_reduce_uncertainty: Access to: (1) HR turnover data by role, department, and month for 2022-2025, (2) Exit interview summaries by termination reason (burnout, compensation, career, management, culture), (3) Turnover correlation analysis vs incident timing (Exchange Dec 2022, ScienceLogic Sept 2024, CL0P Oct 2024), (4) Voluntary vs involuntary termination breakdown, (5) Time-to-backfill by role showing replacement lag, (6) Offer acceptance rates and candidate decline reasons (employer brand assessment).

uncertainty_register.unknown: Platform architect team size, capability depth, and succession planning - are platforms managed by 1 person, 2-3 person teams, or deeper benches?
uncertainty_register.decision_impact: Cannot assess platform operational continuity risk without knowing architect concentration. If platforms managed by SINGLE INDIVIDUALS (worst case): (1) Vacation/illness creates incident response gap - no backup available, (2) Departure creates UNRECOVERABLE knowledge loss - tribal knowledge walks out, (3) Hiring/retention becomes EXISTENTIAL - losing billing architect halts $2.7B revenue realization. If 2-3 person teams (moderate risk): (1) Some redundancy but insufficient for sustained crisis, (2) Knowledge transfer possible but incomplete, (3) Team attrition still creates severe risk. If deeper benches 5-10+ (low risk): (1) Adequate redundancy for continuity, (2) Knowledge distributed reducing concentration. Affects acquisition integration: Buyer planning to migrate platforms to buyer infrastructure needs to know if Rackspace architects available to support migration or if tribal knowledge prevents.
uncertainty_register.what_would_reduce_uncertainty: Access to: (1) IT organizational charts showing platform team structures, (2) Platform architect job families and headcount by platform, (3) On-call rotations showing how many staff cover each platform 24/7, (4) Platform documentation maturity assessment (can new staff maintain with docs?), (5) Platform vendor support contracts (is Rackspace reliant on vendors for expertise?), (6) Recent platform architect hiring activity (struggling to hire suggests scarcity).
uncertainty_register.risk_of_false_confidence: CRITICAL. Stage 6.3 explicitly identifies platforms as 'SINGLE POINTS OF FAILURE' with 'undocumented logic' and 'tribal knowledge'. Strong inference platforms managed by 1-3 individuals each. If buyer assumes 'large IT organization has deep platform benches' but reality is single architect dependencies, discovers post-acquisition: Platform changes frozen (too risky), incidents unrecoverable (no expertise), architect retention EXISTENTIAL (must pay whatever demanded). Cannot migrate platforms to buyer infrastructure (knowledge walks if architects leave).

FedRAMP: If team 10-15 personnel (minimal for 24/7 coverage + 800+ controls) vs 30-50 (adequate redundancy), determines: (1) Authorization sustainability - minimal team one incident away from control failure, (2) Retention fragility - 3-5 departures catastrophic for minimal team, 10-15 departures manageable for larger team, (3) Expansion capacity - minimal team cannot support new government customers. uncertainty_register.what_would_reduce_uncertainty: Access to: (1) FedRAMP security team organizational chart and headcount, (2) Clearance status breakdown (how many SECRET, TOP SECRET, in-process, denied), (3) UK Sovereign team size and roles, (4) On-call rotation schedules showing coverage depth, (5) Team workload metrics (overtime, incident response time), (6) Recruiting pipelines for both teams (actively hiring? struggling to fill?), (7) Retention programs specific to these constrained talent pools.
uncertainty_register.risk_of_false_confidence: HIGH for FedRAMP (10-15% revenue), MEDIUM for UK Sovereign (<5% revenue). If FedRAMP team MINIMAL and buyer assumes adequate, discovers: Cannot maintain authorization with any attrition, cannot grow government business (no capacity), must invest $5-10M building team redundancy or accept $270-410M revenue loss. Three incidents in 36 months stresses security team - if already minimal, burnout → attrition → authorization jeopardy → customer termination wave.

uncertainty_register.unknown: Compensation benchmarking relative to hyperscalers and competitors - is Rackspace paying market rates or discounted? What premium required to recruit post-incidents?

If Rackspace paying 80-90% of AWS/Azure/Google compensation (likely given thin margins): (1) Talent continuously recruited away by hyperscalers, (2) Cannot hire to backfill without raising comp = margin pressure, (3) Retention programs require above-market offers = expensive. Stage 9.2 estimates '20-40% salary premium above market required to overcome negative perception' post-incidents. If true: Specialist hires $200-250K market → $240-350K required = $40-100K premium per hire. Across estimated 50-100 annual technical hires = $2-10M additional annual labor cost. Affects: (1) Operating cost modeling, (2) Retention program budgeting, (3) Hiring feasibility (can company afford premiums?), (4) Margin trajectory (labor inflation eats already-thin 3.1% EBITDA).
uncertainty_register.what_would_reduce_uncertainty: Access to: (1) Compensation benchmarking studies vs AWS, Azure, Google, competitors, (2) Offer acceptance/decline analysis with declined candidate feedback, (3) Retention bonus program budget and effectiveness, (4) Salary band structures and recent adjustments, (5) Recruiting cost per hire by role (shows market difficulty), (6) Employee compensation satisfaction survey results.
uncertainty_register.risk_of_false_confidence: MEDIUM-HIGH. If buyer assumes 'can hire at market rates' but reality requires 20-40% premium due to brand damage (three incidents, CEO churn, declining satisfaction), hiring budget $5-15M annually insufficient creating: Prolonged vacancies (cannot afford market+premium), quality compromise (hire below-market candidates), retention failures (existing staff see premium offers for external hires, demand parity or leave). Margin pressure compounds - labor inflation + revenue decline = profitability collapse.

uncertainty_register.unknown: Heroic execution sustainability - how long can current burnout levels be sustained before death spiral accelerates? Are we at inflection point?
uncertainty_register.decision_impact: Cannot predict when burnout → attrition transitions from linear to exponential. Stage 4.5 identifies FIVE zones with HIGH to EXTREME burnout risk. Indicators suggest NEAR INFLECTION: (1) Three CEOs three years = leadership unsustainability PROVEN, (2) Three incidents 36 months = operations under continuous stress, (3) Trustpilot 'worse' 2024 = customer-facing degradation visible, (4) CapEx -25% = no relief investment in automation/redundancy. UNKNOWABLE because individual burnout thresholds vary - some employees sustain heroics for years, others months. But TREND CLEAR: situation degrading not improving. Affects: (1) Integration timing - should buyer close quickly before attrition accelerates? (2) Retention program urgency - is this survivable or must immediately invest $10-20M in retention?, (3) Segment triage - which segments exit before death spiral vs attempt to save?
uncertainty_register.what_would_reduce_uncertainty: CANNOT be fully reduced (human behavior unpredictable) but indicators help: (1) Employee engagement surveys showing satisfaction trends, (2) Glassdoor reviews showing sentiment trajectory, (3) Voluntary termination rates by quarter (accelerating?), (4) Time-to-backfill trending (lengthening = market aware of problems), (5) Customer satisfaction scores correlating with operations team changes, (6) Incident MTTR trends (lengthening = capacity loss). Leading indicators may provide 3-6 month warning before inflection.
uncertainty_register.risk_of_false_confidence: EXTREME. Heroic execution creates APPEARANCE of stability until sudden collapse. Exchange service DISCONTINUATION demonstrates - appeared manageable until decided unrecoverable. CEO churn demonstrates - each CEO appears capable until departs/replaced. If buyer assumes 'current state sustainable for 12-24 month integration', but death spiral inflection occurs 3-6 months post-close, faces: Mass attrition destroying operations, customer churn wave from service degradation, segment exits (government, UK Sovereign, possibly Private Cloud), value destruction 30-70%. Cannot be predicted precisely but TREND CONCERNING.
